name: gazebo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small decorated building with a roof and open sides, usually in a garden : She wanted to build a gazebo in her back garden. Let's have drinks in the gazebo. Compare
summerhouse
Kevin Miller/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
mainly UK (usually US party tent, canopy tent) a tent or temporary structure with open sides, used especially for events held outside: The pub plans to erect a large gazebo where customers can eat and drink outside under shelter. Compare
marquee
More examplesFewer examplesVines can be encouraged to grow up a variety of structures such as gazebos, pergolas, or fences.The shady town square has an elegant white gazebo.The garden has a gazebo, fountain, and lush landscaping.They put up a large marquee on the lawn for the wedding meal and disco, as well as a gazebo for drinks. We always take a gazebo when we go camping to provide extra covered space.
